availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, shoemaker. Massachusetts native. Married to Eliza L. Waters. Father of John T. Waters. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky in 1850. Employed George W. Gould and G.L. Clark as tinners in Louisville in 1850. Shoemaker in Louisville in 1860. Employed E. Shepherd as a servant in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville District 3, p. 267B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville Ward 6, p. 371.
